title: Commander keen MMORPG.
content:
What do you think about a keen MMORPG?



[center]: -->[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-annoyed.gif[/img]:"> pogo[/center]

title: A Keen MMORPG?
content:
How would this be possible?

Traditionally, MMORPGs are created from existing franchises in which multiple "main" characters exist, alongside a pool of enemies which may or may not be recurring throughout the series.

As an example, Final Fantasy XI utilized the Job system from FF2/5/Tactics/TacticsAdvance to present players with a dozen or so different ways to play the 4 races available, while offering monsters which have been series mainstays, like Tonberries, Chocobos, Flans and Bombs.

World of Warcraft took the existing races and abilities from Humans, Orcs, Undead, and Elves, and utilized their extant lore involving Gnomes, Trolls, Ogres, and Dragons.

What does Keen have to offer, in this regard? An MMORPG needs Quests, Enemies, Town NPCs, and Sidequests. How would you get all of this to work, when the only recurring "Hero" is Keen, and the only recurring "Villian" (albeit indirectly) is McMire?

Yes, we have Vorticons, who have an established society. Yes, we have the Bloogs and their relationship with the Fleex and Bips. Yes, we have the Oracle Members of Gnosticus IV, and the creatures which roam the wilds of the Shadowlands... But all three cannot (well, should not) exist within the same game universe. The shoddy plot of the Keen GBC game proved that.

As much as I think it'd be fun to run around Keen-style with other people in an interactive online environment, I don't think there's enough raw CONTENT to warrant an MMORPG based in the Keeniverse.

IMKO a Crystal Caves MMORPG would be more interesting (and plausible)...[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: A Keen MMORPG?
content:
I've been thinking how a Keen MMORPG could be made.

In the MMORPG you wouldn't be keen, you would be yourself.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-helmet.gif[/img]

The goal of the game would be to save keen from mortimer and also maybe saving the universe.

A story could also be made, like the vorticon king has gathered random people from earth to save keen.

There would be a waiting room to talk and plan group missions.

Anything is possible.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img]

"Anything is possible. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img] "
Indeed, if someone has the time and all the required skills to create it.

Anyways, not the biggest fan of this kind of gaming, but if done properly it could be fun. And yeah, naturally it wouldn't be that race-based like some other such games, but nonetheless it could be interesting with the existing races. Naturally one'd need to make up a lot new stuff. (But then again, inventing history and stuff for known characters doesn't change them officially, so it wouldn't really matter.)

"But all three cannot (well, should not) exist within the same game universe."
Well, if Keen can still use B-w-B that shouldn't be much of a problem. Naturally the time must be 'after' the original games in such a game, or something.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: well...
content:
Bullshit. They may track what you look for, but that happens anonymously, they don't save the IPs, just how many times a keyword has been searched for. Getting viruses depend on what sites you visit -- and as long as you don't visit any wrong sites you'll never get THAT risk. And you almost never will visit a wrong site if you type normal keywords in search engines (don't start with the illegal/disgusting stuff though).

Type "Commander Keen" and none of the sites you'll find on Google will have any danger of containing a virus. And if one does, then you always have that nice virus blocking software, right?

If you still don't trust that stuff, use Wikipedia. The stuff on there isn't ALWAYS fully trustable because anyone can contribute to it, but it's good for most keywords.
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/]en.wikipedia.org/[/url]

(Actually this reminds me of me telling you how I can make an app that would manage the comics online, using a part of my webspace, and you said that I might make a virus in it or something. Virus danger is lower than you'd think. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] )


To get back on topic, I'd rather see a normal Keen RPG first, in the style of Paper Mario or something. That would be neat, and can always be expanded on later.____________

Even though I am an ordinary man.

title: Re: well...
content:
Search engines don't install viruses, MMORPGs install viruses!

Also a Keen MMORPG is pretty much outside the realm of possibility.
Multiple races aren't absolutely necesary for anything, as long as characters can still develop and evolve over time.
The problem, if you can call it that, is that the Keen universe is really small, so a lot of new stuff would have to be thought of to make a MMORPG comparable to others, and all that new stuff will potentially make the game less Keen.
Keen can jump, shoot, climb poles, pogo... that doesn't really give much room for a job aspect to the gameplay unless things are added, although I suppose the killing enemies thing would be easy enough to implement.

Then again an MMORPG doesn't necesarily have to resemble other MMORPG, I'm sure if the right person thought about it, (s)he'd be able to think of something that would work well.
Of course there aren't many people like that in this world.Retodon8

title: I see...
content:
But that's one of the greatest things about the Internet--the sheer freedom. It can be a great tool if you're willing to dive in and swim through its depths, rather than simply surfing around its edges. But you've gotta allow some room to breathe.

I could rant about the paranoid setup Gareth has going there, but I don't feel like going into those details right now. Though I do hope he's running Spybot or something, since adware tends to pose a higher [more frequent at least] security risk than viruses.

title: Re: I see...
content:
The internet IS pretty safe -- whether it becomes unsafe depends on what sites you visit, what programs you download/use, and what you're looking for. Besides that, you can't tell people what to put on the net and what not, but depending on the site you're on any offensive material could be removed as soon as possible, or welcomed with open arms (like kiddie porn [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img] You won't find it anywhere but on the wrong sites, and if you see it anywhere else it's probably a violation of the rules and gets removed as quickly as possible.)

Seriously, two firewalls is ok, but three is overkill. Virus scanning every so many days is enough, too.

Just trust the people who are experienced in using the internet, ok? Even IF you downloaded a virus, there's often live protection in virus scanners which find and try to destroy the virus as soon as you try to open a downloaded file. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________

title: hehe
content:
That's great for a framework, LoG, but since the core of an MMORPG is the "grind" of gameplay, the world needs to be particularly well-developed from a plot perspective in order to make the experience memorable.

Long story short, there has to be some well-written reason for the three previously isolated races to become involved with one another.

Bloogs by themselves don't really do much--they're the grunt labor-force of the planet. Hired goons. The Fleex are the ones who designed everything; the Bloogs simply manufactured it, ruining the efficiency of the design. The Bips are the cogs of the machinery--without them, very little technology would operate.

The Shikadi are by far the most advanced race--not only the capabilities of interstellar flight, like the Vorticons, but teleportation and the ability to manifest energy from their beings? That's terrifying. Vorticons, at least, are like humans insofar that they rely on technology (or mastery of martial arts) to do their damage. A being made entirely from substances which are lethal to humans? Yikes!

Sure, each race offers unique 'abilities' and could play differently, but what would the goal/point be? What contrived little plot would weave these different strands of lore together? What classes or other gameplay options would be available, and why would they exist? How do the Fighter/Ranger/Mage archetypes fit into this universe?

There's enough in the Keen games for a skeletal layout, at best. Everything else would be like pulling teeth, and, IMKO, would require an amount of fabrication not far from simply creating a unique MMORPG, free from the copyright-infringement and licensing issues involved with the Keeniverse.

Just my two cents, naturally. I'm still open to new ideas, but the core of the matter is that there's no EXISTING reason for the three primary Keen races to cross each others' paths.
